comments.body:
I took my inspiration from the `libpng`-provided [`bld.bat`][1], which used

```
mkdir build-%SUBDIR%-%c_compiler%
```

I couldn't find any mention of `SUBDIR` or `c_compiler` (or `f_compiler`) in the [environment variables][2] doc, so am not sure what would be the best move here. (Similar question applies to the build directory created in `build.sh`.)

**UPDATE**: I see in a [build][3] that `fortran_compiler=flang` and `m2w64_fortran_compiler=m2w64-toolchain` get set.

[1]: https://github.com/conda-forge/libpng-feedstock/blob/13bf3cf2b80c996c1bb0f32695b246362b047d40/recipe/bld.bat
[2]: https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/user-guide/environment-variables.html
[3]: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/conda-forge/staged-recipes/builds/30579704
